title: What are historic examples of human migration? - Quora

response.answer_text: My favorite are west goths (Visigoths). These folks moved on and on for generations.  If I recall the story correctly, they started more or less from what is today Poland, went south-east until hitting the black sea, then moved over the danube into Roman empire, continued moving west over italy and france, crossed over to (what is today) Spain and finally moved over Gibraltar to settle in today's Algeria.  Earlier today, we had a visit from Algeria and one of the ladies was of typical germanic type, blond, blue eyes etc. She told me that this is very common in north Algeria. Go figure?

The movement of Neanderthals,  and later Home Sapiens (our kind of  human) out of Africa, into the Middle East and on to Asia and Europe.  In more recent times the Doric Migration.  See Greece, A History of Ancient Greece, The Dorians In even more recent times  movement of Armenians out of Turkey (it was forced migration) And now the movement of people out of Syrian, essentially running for their lives.
